summary: Email chain from April 2023 between a law firm representing the Epstein estate's co-executor and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The law firm reports that a document reviewer, while working on litigation against JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank, discovered a video that may contain child pornography. The firm also requests access to a specific HP computer seized from Epstein's Little St. James property. The prosecutor coordinates contact with FBI agents.

persons.name: Amanda
persons.context: Identified as an FBI Special Agent and point of contact for the reported suspected child pornography video found by the Epstein estate's document reviewer.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Co-executor of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Client of the law firm Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP; one of the two co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual whose estate is being administered; his properties were subject to law enforcement seizures.

connections.description: Kahn is a co-executor of Epstein's estate, responsible for its administration.

events.title: Law firm requests access to seized computer
events.description: Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP emails the U.S. Attorney's Office requesting access to an HP Slim Tower computer seized from the 'generator room' on Little St. James.

events.title: Discovery of suspected child pornography video
events.description: A document reviewer for the Epstein estate, working on litigation against JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank, finds a video that may contain child pornography. The law firm reports this to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Prosecutor coordinates with FBI
events.description: A Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office responds, cc'ing FBI Special Agent Amanda and an NYPD detective, to coordinate the formal report of the suspected child pornography and the request for the seized computer.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
New York, New York 10036 (Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP)
keyFacts: In April 2023, a document reviewer for the Epstein estate discovered a video suspected to contain child pornography while reviewing materials for lawsuits against JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank.
The law firm representing estate co-executor Richard Kahn was seeking access to a specific HP computer seized from the 'generator room' on Epstein's island, Little St. James.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York coordinated the response, involving FBI Special Agent Amanda and an NYPD detective.
This document shows ongoing legal and investigative activity related to Epstein's estate and evidence years after his death.
The suspected child pornography was discovered in the context of civil litigation against major financial institutions (JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank).
